description: p + R{p} where R{p} is the digit reversal of n-th prime p.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(4) = 14 = 7 + 7, 7 is the fourth prime; a(8) = 110 = 19 + 91, 19 is the eighth prime.
prog: (Haskell)a061227 n = p + a004086 p  where p = a000040 n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 04 2014
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 22 2001
extensions: More terms from _Patrick De Geest_, Jun 04 2001.
